intro: Pilosella lactocantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features dense, hairy foliage that helps it retain moisture in its native habitat. It produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pilosella lactocantabrica is often found in rocky or grassy areas, showcasing its adaptability to diverse environmental conditions.
